name: Martin Kerr
description:
A folk troubadour for the post-truth age, his outspoken lyrics and soaring voice are connecting with millions of listeners around the world. He blends the urgent issues of the day with deeply personal narratives in nostalgic folk arrangements that invite you to sing along.

Explosive growth on social media has seen him reach over 50 million people in just the last few months, with his controversial rewrites of classic songs like God Rest Ye Merry Billionaires, Away In Bomb Shelters, and What's Up America? being adopted as anthems for justice and democracy. Making waves with his captivating live performances, he's opened for Dermot Kennedy, Sarah McLachlan, Walk Off the Earth, Blue Rodeo, The Strumbellas, and played festival stages across North America.

name: Sorauren Farmers' Market
description:
During the winter months, the market moves indoors to Henderson Brewery. Live music and themed events invite the community to enjoy this vibrant and cozy indoor space. Thanks to this partnership, farmers, food artisans, and prepared food vendors can continue to provide fresh local food to residents in the area year-round.

We hope to see you there!

The Sorauren Farmers' Market Association is a non-profit organization dedicated to fostering community connections and offering fresh, wholesome food since 2008. 
We believe that people thrive when they feel safe, connected, and supported beyond their basic needs. We support diverse voices and promote ecological preservation, benefiting sustainable farmers, local producers, artists, and volunteers. Food security for all is central to our mission.

name: Riverside Window Wonderland and Art Walk Tour
description:
This holiday season, visit over 25 holiday storefront windows by local artists on storefronts!

Check out our online map, visit the locations, vote on your faves and enter our raffle for local prizes. You can also sign up for our guided tour!

name: Clash of the Drums
description:
In a stunning twist, three of the best percussionists in Toronto's Latin American music scene are joining forces for one night of magic! 

Matias Recharte and Aline Morales both perform in Kune Global Orchestra. Hailing from Lima, Peru and Belo Horizonte, Brazil, respectively, Recharte and Morales will be joined by Magdelys Savigne, of OKAN. Savigne is from Santiago, Cuba, and will bring scintillating Afro-Cuban rhythms to this Latin-flavoured polyphonic orchestral experience. 

You won't want to miss this!
